1.text: LET a man so account of us as of the ministers of Christ, and the dispensers of the mysteries of God.

2.text: Here now it is required among the dispensers, that a man be found faithful.

3.text: But to me it is a very small thing to be judged by you, or by man’s day; but neither do I judge my own self.

4.text: For I am not conscious to myself of any thing, yet am I not hereby justified; but he that judgeth me, is the Lord.

5.text: Therefore judge not before the time; until the Lord come, who both will bring to light the hidden things of darkness, and will make manifest the counsels of the hearts; and then shall every man have praise from God.

6.text: But these things, brethren, I have in a figure transferred to myself and to Apollo, for your sakes; that in us you may learn, that one be not puffed up against the other for another, above that which is written.

7.text: For who distinguisheth thee ? Or what hast thou that thou hast not received ? And if thou hast received, why dost thou glory, as if thou hadst not received it ?

8.text: You are now full; you are now become rich; you reign without us; and I would to God you did reign, that we also might reign with you.

9.text: For I think that God hath set forth us apostles, the last, as it were men appointed to death: we are made a spectacle to the world, and to angels, and to men.

10.text: We are fools for Christ’s sake, but you are wise in Christ; we are weak, but you are strong; you are honourable, but we without honour.

11.text: Even unto this hour we both hunger and thirst, and are naked, and are buffeted, and have no fixed abode;

12.text: And we labour, working with our own hands: we are reviled, and we bless; we are persecuted, and we suffer it.

13.text: We are blasphemed, and we entreat; we are made as the refuse of this world, the offscouring of all even until now.

14.text: I write not these things to confound you; but I admonish you as my dearest children.

15.text: For if you have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yet not many fathers. For in Christ Jesus, by the gospel, I have begotten you.

16.text: Wherefore I beseech you, be ye followers of me, as I also am of Christ.

17.text: For this cause have I sent to you Timothy, who is my dearest son and faithful in the Lord; who will put you in mind of my ways, which are in Christ Jesus; as I teach every where in every church.

18.text: As if I would not come to you, so some are puffed up.

19.text: But I will come to you shortly, if the Lord will: and will know, not the speech of them that are puffed up, but the power.

20.text: For the kingdom of God is not in speech, but in power.

21.text: What will you ? shall I come to you with a rod; or in charity, and in the spirit of meekness ?
